results.title: Community life, women and the Temple of Karnak
results.creator_credit: Peter Spry-Leverton and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Ancient lives”.
John Romer focuses on the role of women in ancient Egypt and their rituals such as birthing practices as well as reading some Egyptian love poetry. Romer explains the mathematical perfection of the Great Temple of Karnak, and provides an insight into the workings of the village oracle, the supernatural and medical treatment.

results.title: Community in quest
results.creator_credit: Lyn Littman, Extension Media Center, National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.) and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Depicts the political realities that can prevent much needed drug programs from operating in a town. In this film the city leaders are frightened when their traditional values are threatened by unknown methods and they react negatively to a drug program which utilises sensitivity and role playing techniques.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lyn Littman, Extension Media Center, National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.) and University of California, Los Angeles

results.title: Community health and you
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Health and Safety for You”
Talks about health in reference to our daily lives, eg water, and how we have to be careful and make sure water that reaches the community is clean and safe to consume. Also goes into general cleanliness in relation to sewerage and garbage to prevent disease entering our lives.

results.title: Communities keep clean
results.brief_description: Compares community cleaning to house cleaning and includes scenes of street cleaning, water purification, park upkeep, landfill projects and air apollution control. Emphasizes that community upkeep is a shared responsibility.

results.title: Communities depend on each other
results.brief_description: Descibes how communities depend on each other for goods and services such as food, clothing, appliances, magazines, automobiles and fuel. Explains the role of transportation and communication.

results.title: Communication: getting it going
results.creator_credit: George Cass and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program shows some of the ways the theme communication can be developed in primary and postprimary English programs. The English framework encourages these ideas as a means of extending and enriching the experiences of all students.

results.title: Communication: getting in touch
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: An alien colony settles on earth and language differences present a problem. This film shows in a humorous way how communicating with others involves getting in touch with their ways of exchanging information; and how to overcome the three barriers to communication: linguistic, sociological and personal. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Communication satellites
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems of World Order”.
Explores the world implications of sophisticated ommunication facilities, particularly with respect to technologically advanced and underdeveloped countries. Focuses on control problems of potential power of the Intersat and the Comsat. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Communicating with kinder kids
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: A video “test” for interested groups e.g. health care workers, audiologists, speech therapists, kindergarten teachers and parents, so that they can recognise language and speech disorders in kindergarten age children.
